result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack G Trebtoske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 50 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must undergo a psychological evaluation and follow thru with any and all recommendations.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars except for employment purposes.
The defendant is eligible for expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of all of the terms/conditions of probation.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must enroll and successfully complete an anger management course.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(7).

To be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

As deemed appropriate by P&P.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed. Eligible for community service under 973.03(3). Jail credit to be determined.
Consecutive to: Any sentence that the defendant is currently serving or any imposed and stayed sentence.

Hearing on September 19, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:43 PM. Called all four matters to determine credit, other case numbers are 17CF176, 17CF74, 15CF25 and 15CF11. State has not been able to calculate the credit due for stated reasons. Lynch has the numbers he believes is the appropriate credit for the cases.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Revoked

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Plans to seek
Hearing on September 12, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in custody from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF176, 17CF11, 15CF74 and 17CF25. Called 3:18 PM. State - here for sentencing after revocation - 15CF74 and 15CF176 - here for SEHR and on other two cases - they were imposed and stayed (6 months each - consecutive to each other - 17CF11 and 17CF25) and have already been imposed. Lynch agrees. On 15CF176 - counts #1 and #2 and on 15CF74 - count #1. All parties have reviewed the revocation summaries, Lynch has no corrections or errors. State - 15CF176 - those counts are as repeaters as well. Court and Lynch agrees. State - on 15CF74 - credit for 399 days and on 15CF176 - credit for 396 days - if everything is run concurrent to each other. Discussion on credit. Court is willing to give the parties another sentencing date to give everybody more time to figure out the credit. State would agree with that. Court - can proceed to sentencing and can always set matter for a hearing to determine the credit. State makes final argument prior to his recommendation - recommends on 15CF74 - 1 year in FC jail - consecutive to any and all sentences currently imposed, on 15CF176 - 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to 15CF74. Lynch makes final argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 1 year in FC jail on each case - concurrent to each other and concurrent to any sentence that he is currently serving. Trebtoske makes statement, asks Court to consider the argument of his counsel and also asks for concurrent time a well. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 15CF74 - 1 year in FC jail - consecutive to any sentence that he is currently serving or are I&S; on 15CF176 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to each other but consecutive to 15CF74 and to any sentences that he is currently serving or are I&S, huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3)60 days after release from custody to pay any unpaid court costs/CO, right to appeal, set for a hearing to determine credit, adjourned.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 22, 2018 at 03:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 15, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:38 PM. Richards - resolved. State - plead G to count #1 as alleged, #2 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 90 days conditional jail, costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments that sell alcohol, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, free to request expunction by defense. Richards and Trebtoske agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Trebtoske pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Richards makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - requests expunction under 973.015 - 50 days credit if revoked (stipulated). Trebtoske makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 90 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7) - credit for 50 days only if revoked, costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, undergo a psychological evaluation and follow thru with any recommendations, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars except for employment purposes, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service within the first 6 months of probation, will authorize expungement under 973.015 upon succeessful completion of all the terms/conditions of probation, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned. Called FC 15-12904 at 2:09 PM. Richards/State want to address the $2500.00 cash bond. State - bond - reduce to signature bond with same conditions. Court - bond - $3000.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol.
